name: TrES-3
scenarioDescription:
The TrES-3 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TrES-3 is a star with 0.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.83 times its radius. It is located 743.64 light years away from the solar system.

TrES-3 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TrES-3 system


TrES-3 b

TrES-3 b was discovered by the TrES observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TrES-3 b is 607.38 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TrES-3 b is 14.975 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TrES-3 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TrES-3, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by TrES.
